sen.j: ミョウガ（茗荷、学名：Zingiber mioga）はショウガ科ショウガ属の多年草。
sen.e: Myoga is a term used to refer to a herbaceous perennial which belongs to Family Zingiberaceae Genus Zingiber (scientific name: Zingiber mioga)..
Myoga is a term that refers to a herbaceous perennial belong to the family Zingiberaceae, genus Zingiber (scientific name: Zingiber mioga).
Myoga is a term that refers to a herbaceous perennial belong to the family Zingiberaceae, genus Zingiber (scientific name: Zingiber mioga).

sen.j: 食用として利用される。
sen.e: Myoga has been used as food.
Myoga has been used as a food.
Myoga has been used as a food.

sen.j: 東アジア（温帯）が原産。
sen.e: Myoga is originated in the East Asia (the temperature zone).
Myoga originated in East Asia (in the Temperate Zone).
Myoga originated in East Asia (in the Temperate Zone).

sen.j: 日本の山野に自生しているものもあるが、人間が生活していたと考えられる場所以外では見られないことや、野生種がなく、染色体異常（基本数x＝11、2n5x55）であることなどから、大陸から持ち込まれて栽培されてきたと考えられる。
sen.e: Although some of them are found in mountains of Japan, Myoga is considered to have been imported from the Asian continent and grown in Japan because they are normally found only in areas in which people lived in the past, there is no wild species, and their chromosome is abnormal (the basic number x=11, 2n5x55).

Although it is sometimes found in the mountains of Japan, Myoga is considered to have been imported from the Asian continent and grown in Japan because it's normally found only in areas in which people have lived in the past, there is no wild species and the chromosome is abnormal (the basic number x=11, 2n5x55).

Although it is sometimes found in the mountains of Japan, Myoga is considered to have been imported from the Asian continent and grown in Japan because it's normally found only in areas in which people have lived in the past, there is no wild species and the chromosome is abnormal (the basic number x=11, 2n5x55).

sen.j: 花穂および若芽の茎が食用とされる。
sen.e: Their spikes and stems of sprouts are used as food.
The spikes and stems of sprouts are used for food.
The spikes and stems of sprouts are used for food.

sen.j: 雌雄同株で、花器にも雄蕊、雌蕊とも揃っている両性花が開花する。
sen.e: Myoga is monoecious, and perfect flowers bloom which have pistils and stamens in their flower organs.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Myoga is monoecious, and the perfect flowers carry both pistils and stamens.
Myoga is monoecious, and the perfect flowers carry both pistils and stamens.

sen.j: しかし、5倍体のため、受精しても親と同じ数の染色体数になることは稀である。
sen.e: However, because they are pentaploid, the number of chromosome rarely becomes the same as that of their parents even if fertilization is made.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, because they are pentaploid the number of chromosomes is rarely the same as that of their parents, even if fertilization is made.
However, because they are pentaploid the number of chromosomes is rarely the same as that of their parents, even if fertilization is made.

sen.j: 従って、繁殖は地下茎による栄養体繁殖が主体である。
sen.e: Reproduction is, therefore, mainly made by underground stems through trophozoite multiplication.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, reproduction is generally accomplished by underground stems through trophozoite multiplication.
Therefore, reproduction is generally accomplished by underground stems through trophozoite multiplication.

sen.j: しかし夏から秋にかけて温度が高い時にごく稀に実を結ぶことがある。
sen.e: However, they infrequently bear fruit in summer or autumn when it is hot.
However, they infrequently bear fruit in the summer or autumn, when it is hot.
However, they infrequently bear fruit in the summer or autumn, when it is hot.

sen.j: 地上部に見える葉を伴った茎状のものは、先端に花を生じないので、偽茎と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Stem-like objects over the ground having leaves are called a pseudostem because they bear no flowers at their ends
Stem-like objects over the ground having leaves are called pseudostems because they bear no flowers at their ends.
Stem-like objects over the ground having leaves are called pseudostems because they bear no flowers at their ends.

tit.j: 食材としてのミョウガ

sen.j: 通常「花みょうが」、「みょうが」と呼ばれるものが花穂で、内部には開花前の蕾が3〜12個程度存在する。
sen.e: Spikes, which are normally called as Hana-myoga or Myoga, each include three to twelve flower buds in them.
Spikes, which are normally called Hana-myoga or Myoga, each include three to 12 flower buds.
Spikes, which are normally called Hana-myoga or Myoga, each include three to 12 flower buds.

sen.j: そのため、この部分を「花蕾」と呼ぶ場合もある。
sen.e: Therefore, this portion is sometimes also called as a Karai (flower bud).
Therefore, this portion is sometimes also called the Karai (flower bud).
Therefore, this portion is sometimes also called the Karai (flower bud).

sen.j: 一方若芽を軟白し、弱光で薄紅色に着色させたものを「みょうがたけ」と呼ぶ。
sen.e: On the other hand, sprouts, which have been etiolated and pink-colored by weak light, are called as Myoga-take.
However, the sprouts, which have been etiolated and become pink-colored in the weak light, are called Myoga-take.
However, the sprouts, which have been etiolated and become pink-colored in the weak light, are called Myoga-take.

sen.j: 「花みょうが」は、晩夏から初秋にかけ発生し、秋を告げる風味として喜ばれ、一方「みょうがたけ」は春の食材である。
sen.e: While Hana-myoga can be harvested in late summer and early autumn and enjoyed as a foodstuff of autumn, Myoga-take is a foodstuff of spring.
While Hana-myoga can be harvested in late summer and early fall and enjoyed as an autumn foodstuff, Myoga-take is a foodstuff of spring.
While Hana-myoga can be harvested in late summer and early fall and enjoyed as an autumn foodstuff, Myoga-take is a foodstuff of spring.

sen.j: 独特の香りが好まれ、また特有の紅色が目を楽しませる。
sen.e: They are welcomed by people because of their special fragrance and pink color.
They are welcomed by people because of their special fragrance and pink color.
They are welcomed by people because of their special fragrance and pink color.

sen.j: このため蕎麦、素麺などの薬味として利用される。
sen.e: They are used as a spice for Soba, Somen, etc.
They are used as a spice for soba, somen, etc.
They are used as a spice for soba, somen, etc.

sen.j: この場合香辛菜として利用されることになる。
sen.e: In this case, they are used as a condiment vegetable.
In this case, they are used as a condiment vegetable.
In this case, they are used as a condiment vegetable.

sen.j: そのほか、天ぷらや酢の物、味噌汁の具など、独立した食材としても用いられる。
sen.e: In addition, they are also used as an independent foodstuff for other foods, such as Tempura, Su-no-mono, Miso soup, etc.
Additionally, they're used as an independent foodstuff for other foods, such as tempura, su-no-mono, miso soup, etc.
Additionally, they're used as an independent foodstuff for other foods, such as tempura, su-no-mono, miso soup, etc.

sen.j: 夏が旬の野菜である。
sen.e: Myoga is a summer vegetable.
Myoga is a summer vegetable.
Myoga is a summer vegetable.

sen.j: 農家では、山椒・ミツバとならび、果樹園・庭・屋敷林の木陰に、薬味として、育てておく代表的な植物である。
sen.e: Farmers frequently grow Myoga in shady places together with Sansho (Japanese pepper) and Mitsuba (Japanese honewort) in their fruit farms, gardens, or homestead woodlands as a spice
Farmers frequently grow Myoga as a spice in shady places together with Sansho (Japanese pepper) and Mitsuba (Japanese honewort) in their fruit orchards, gardens or homestead woodlands.
Farmers frequently grow Myoga as a spice in shady places together with Sansho (Japanese pepper) and Mitsuba (Japanese honewort) in their fruit orchards, gardens or homestead woodlands.

sen.j: 香り成分はα-ピネン類。
sen.e: The fragrance component is a-pinene.
The fragrance component is a-pinene.
The fragrance component is a-pinene.

sen.j: 紅色の成分は水溶性植物色素アントシアニンの一種、マルビジンである。
sen.e: The pink color component is malvidin, a kind of anthocyanin which is a water-soluble plant pigment.
The pink color component is malvidin, a kind of anthocyanin that is a water-soluble plant pigment.
The pink color component is malvidin, a kind of anthocyanin that is a water-soluble plant pigment.

sen.j: 植物体内ではグルコース1分子と結合し、マルビジンモノグリコシドとして存在する。
sen.e: The malvidin combines with a molecule of glucose in a plant to become malvidin monoglucoside.
The malvidin combines with a molecule of glucose in a plant to become malvidin monoglucoside.
The malvidin combines with a molecule of glucose in a plant to become malvidin monoglucoside.

sen.j: 俗に「食べると物忘れがひどくなる」と言われているが、栄養学的にそのような成分は含まれていない。
sen.e: Although it is said that people tend to lose memorizing ability if they eat Myoga, it contains no such components.
Although it is said that people tend to lose the ability to remember things if they eat Myoga, it contains no such component.
Although it is said that people tend to lose the ability to remember things if they eat Myoga, it contains no such component.

sen.j: 逆に近年、香り成分に集中力を増す効果があることが明らかになっている。
sen.e: Conversely, it has become obvious recently that it contains a fragrance component which increases the ability to concentrate.
Conversely, it has recently become cler that it contains a fragrance component that increases the ability to concentrate.
Conversely, it has recently become cler that it contains a fragrance component that increases the ability to concentrate.

sen.j: 無機成分では窒素とカリウムが多く含まれ、食物繊維（粗繊維）が多い。
sen.e: Myoga contains a large amount of inorganic components, such as nitrogen and potassium, and a large amount of vegetable fibers (crude fibers).
Myoga contains large amounts of organic components, such as nitrogen and potassium, and a large amount of vegetable fiber (crude fiber).
Myoga contains large amounts of organic components, such as nitrogen and potassium, and a large amount of vegetable fiber (crude fiber).

sen.j: 大陸からショウガとともに持ち込まれた際、香りの強いほうを「兄香（せのか）」、弱いほうを「妹香（めのか）」と呼んだ。
sen.e: When Shoga (ginger) and Myoga were imported from the Asian continent, those having strong fragrance were called as Senoka (strong fragrance) and those having weak fragrance were called Menoka (weak fragrance).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When Shoga (ginger) and Myoga were imported from the Asian continent, those with a strong fragrance were called Senoka (strong fragrance) and those with a weak fragrance were called Menoka (weak fragrance).

When Shoga (ginger) and Myoga were imported from the Asian continent, those with a strong fragrance were called Senoka (strong fragrance) and those with a weak fragrance were called Menoka (weak fragrance).

sen.j: これがのちにショウガ・ミョウガに転訛したとの説が有力である。
sen.e: It is said that the term Senoka has changed to Shoga and the term Menoka has changed to Myoga.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is said that the term "Senoka" has since changed to "Shoga" and the term "Menoka" has changed to Myoga.
It is said that the term "Senoka" has since changed to "Shoga" and the term "Menoka" has changed to Myoga.

sen.j: なお、名の由来に関しては下に挙げるような俗説がある。
sen.e: It is to noted that there is a folklore on the origin of the name as follows.
Significantly, there is folklore on the origin of the name, as follows:
Significantly, there is folklore on the origin of the name, as follows:

sen.j: 釈迦の弟子である周利槃特（梵語：チューラパンタカの音写で、しゅりはんどく、スリバンドクなど）が、自分の名前を忘れてしまうため、釈迦が首に名札をかけさせた。
sen.e: Handoku SHURI (the original pronunciation of his name in Sanskrit is Pantaka Chura), a disciple of Buddha, were instructed by Buddha to wear a nametag because SHURI frequently forgot his own name.
Handoku SHURI (the original pronunciation of his name in Sanskrit was Pantaka Chura), a disciple of Buddha, was instructed by Buddha to wear a nametag because SHURI frequently forgot his own name.
Handoku SHURI (the original pronunciation of his name in Sanskrit was Pantaka Chura), a disciple of Buddha, was instructed by Buddha to wear a nametag because SHURI frequently forgot his own name.

sen.j: しかし名札をかけたことさえも忘れてしまい、とうとう死ぬまで名前を覚えることができなかった。
sen.e: However, SHURI forgot the fact that he was wearing the nametag, and died at last without remembering his own name.
However, SHURI forgot the fact that he was wearing the nametag, and at last he died without remembering his own name.
However, SHURI forgot the fact that he was wearing the nametag, and at last he died without remembering his own name.

sen.j: その後、死んだ周梨槃特の墓にいくと、見慣れない草が生えていた。
sen.e: After his death, an unfamiliar plant was found growing beside Handoku SHURI's tomb.
After his death, an unfamiliar plant was found growing beside Handoku SHURI's tomb.
After his death, an unfamiliar plant was found growing beside Handoku SHURI's tomb.

sen.j: そこで「彼は自分の名前を荷って苦労してきた」ということで、「名」を「荷う」ことから、この草に茗荷と名付けた。
sen.e: The plant was named after SHURI's effort to remember his own name as Myoga, of which two Kanji characters (茗荷) literally means "to carry a name."
The plant was named after SHURI's effort to remember his own name, being called Myoga, of which the two Kanji characters (茗荷) literally mean "to carry a name."
The plant was named after SHURI's effort to remember his own name, being called Myoga, of which the two Kanji characters (茗荷) literally mean "to carry a name."

sen.j: この説は前掲の「物忘れがひどくなる」という話とともに、民話「みょうが宿」から一般化し、人口に膾炙（かいしゃ）するようになったもので、学術的な根拠はない。
sen.e: Although this story, together with the above story of losing the memorizing ability, has become popular as a folklore called as "Myoga-yado", the authenticity has not been proven academically.
Although this story, together with the above story of losing the ability to remember, has become popular as folklore called "Myoga-yado," the authenticity has not been proved academically.
Although this story, together with the above story of losing the ability to remember, has become popular as folklore called "Myoga-yado," the authenticity has not been proved academically.

sen.j: 東京都文京区に、茗荷谷駅という地名がある。
sen.e: A station in Bunkyo Ward, Tokyo Prefecture is called Myogadani Station.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: A station in Bunkyo Ward, Tokyo Prefecture, is called Myogadani Station.
A station in Bunkyo Ward, Tokyo Prefecture, is called Myogadani Station.

sen.j: これは江戸時代までこのあたりで茗荷の栽培が盛んであったことに由来する。
sen.e: The name is originated from the fact that Myoga was actively grown in areas around the station until the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The name originated from the fact that Myoga was actively grown in areas around the station until the Edo period.
The name originated from the fact that Myoga was actively grown in areas around the station until the Edo period.

sen.j: 領地のために命を張った戦国武士などは、戦闘で命が残る「冥加」にかけて、「茗荷」の紋を好んで使用した。
sen.e: In order to survive fighting for lands, many samurais in the Sengoku period preferred to use a picture of Myoga as their symbols in battle fields, because the pronunciation of the term Myoga is the same as that of a term (冥加), of which meaning is a luck

In order to survive in the struggle for lands, many samurais in the Sengoku period preferred to use a picture of Myoga as their symbol on the battlefield, because the pronunciation of the term Myoga is the same as that of the term (冥加), which means luck.

In order to survive in the struggle for lands, many samurais in the Sengoku period preferred to use a picture of Myoga as their symbol on the battlefield, because the pronunciation of the term Myoga is the same as that of the term (冥加), which means luck.

sen.j: 「影茗荷」「鍋島茗荷」などが有名である。
sen.e: Variations of the Myoga symbol, such as Kage-myoga and Nabeshima-myoga, are famous.
Variations of the Myoga symbol, such as Kage-myoga and Nabeshima-myoga, are famous.
Variations of the Myoga symbol, such as Kage-myoga and Nabeshima-myoga, are famous.

sen.j: 一部地方では、みょうがぼち（岐阜県）、みょうが饅頭（熊本県）といった、みょうがの葉を使ったお菓子が今でも食べられている。
sen.e: In some parts of Japan, cakes containing Myoga are still eaten, such as Myoga-mochi (Gifu Prefecture) and Myoga-manju (Kumamoto Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 内容から判断し、「みょうがぼち」は、「みょうがもち」であるものとして訳出致しました。
sen.e: In some parts of Japan, cakes containing Myoga are still eaten, such as Myoga-mochi (Gifu Prefecture) and Myoga-manju (Kumamoto Prefecture).
